Serialized Form

  • Package Home

    • Class Home.Home_User extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • panelIndex

          int panelIndex
          Index for panel selection: 0 - Welcome; 1 - Melody; 2 - Rhythm; 3 - Volume.

        • pressX

          int pressX
          X position on screen - used to enable drag-moving

        • pressY

          int pressY
          Y posotion on screen - used to enable drag-moving

        • aFlag

          int aFlag
          Flag to distinguish if the pitch button A is pressed: 0 - not pressed, 1 - pressed.

        • a_Flag

          int a_Flag
          Flag to distinguish if the pitch button A# is pressed: 0 - not pressed, 1 - pressed.

        • bFlag

          int bFlag
          Flag to distinguish if the pitch button B is pressed: 0 - not pressed, 1 - pressed.

        • cFlag

          int cFlag
          Flag to distinguish if the pitch button C is pressed: 0 - not pressed, 1 - pressed.

        • c_Flag

          int c_Flag
          Flag to distinguish if the pitch button C# is pressed: 0 - not pressed, 1 - pressed.

        • dFlag

          int dFlag
          Flag to distinguish if the pitch button D is pressed: 0 - not pressed, 1 - pressed.

        • d_Flag

          int d_Flag
          Flag to distinguish if the pitch button D# is pressed: 0 - not pressed, 1 - pressed.

        • eFlag

          int eFlag
          Flag to distinguish if the pitch button E is pressed: 0 - not pressed, 1 - pressed.

        • fFlag

          int fFlag
          Flag to distinguish if the pitch button F is pressed: 0 - not pressed, 1 - pressed.

        • f_Flag

          int f_Flag
          Flag to distinguish if the pitch button F# is pressed: 0 - not pressed, 1 - pressed.

        • gFlag

          int gFlag
          Flag to distinguish if the pitch button G is pressed: 0 - not pressed, 1 - pressed.

        • g_Flag

          int g_Flag
          Flag to distinguish if the pitch button G# is pressed: 0 - not pressed, 1 - pressed.

        • firstIndex

          int firstIndex
          The shifting steps from the first pitch in the original row to the first pitch C in chromatic order.

        • clockstr

          java.lang.String clockstr
          The output string for Clock Output.

        • matrixstr

          java.lang.String matrixstr
          The output string for Matrix Output.

        • logstr

          java.lang.String logstr
          The output string for all the log output.

        • tip

          java.lang.String tip
          The output string for Tip output in TipFrame.

        • origin

          java.util.ArrayList<E> origin
          The user input pitch series represented by pitch name.

        • pitchClass

          int[] pitchClass
          The original row (by converting the pitch name in "origin" into numbers according to the Pitch Clock) used to generate the 12-tone Matrix.

        • clockorder

          java.util.HashMap<K,V> clockorder
          The Map storing the clock: to match Pitch names and their assigned value.

        • matrix

          Matrix matrix
          The 12-tone Matrix (All the algorithm implemetations are related to this matrix).

        • musicPlayer

          MusicPlayer musicPlayer
          The MusicPlayer handles all MIDI features: MIDI sequence organising, track generating, MIDI File writing and playing.

        • mClicked

          int mClicked
          If "Melody Change" has been clicked.

        • rhyClicked

          int rhyClicked
          The index of clicked rhythm button, minuet duration row - 1; minuet time point - 2; 12-tone melody with time point - 3.

        • volClicked

          int volClicked
          The index of clicked volume button, minuet volume - 1; 12-tone melody with time point rhythm and volume serialism - 2.

        • mPlayClicked

          int mPlayClicked
          If "Play" (on Melody Panel) clicked, the icon changes to rectangle and tag changes to "Stop", else icon changes to triangle and tag changes to "Play".

        • rPlayClicked

          int rPlayClicked
          If "Play" (on Rhythm Panel) clicked, the icon changes to rectangle and tag changes to "Stop", else icon changes to triangle and tag changes to "Play".

        • vPlayClicked

          int vPlayClicked
          If "Play" (on Volume Panel) clicked, the icon changes to rectangle and tag changes to "Stop", else icon changes to triangle and tag changes to "Play".
